physical_appearance:This is a set of black-and-white documents featuring photographs of an Allied submarine and its interior plan. The first document at the top shows the interior plan through four different sections
 with labels for each room and compartment. The second document below it shows two photographs of the submarine above water. The photographs are accompanied with Chinese captions underneath them. There are no tears seen on either documents.

sgcool_label_text:This image and interior plan of an Allied Submarine belong to Lung Chui Ying and are part of a larger collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was amassed by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from the mid-1990s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a set of black-and-white documents featuring photographs of an Allied submarine and its interior plan. The first document at the top shows the interior plan through four different sections, with labels for each room and compartment. The second document below it shows two photographs of the submarine above water. The photographs are accompanied with Chinese captions underneath them. There are no tears seen on either documents.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This image and interior plan of an Allied Submarine belong to Lung Chui Ying and are part of a larger collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was amassed by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the mid-1990s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.
